CIRCUIT COURT OF

PATRICK CRADDOCK, CLERK
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
ALEX CITY DIVISION
MCGREGOR CHRISTOPHER BLAINE, )
Plaintiff, )
)
V. ) Case No.: DR-2023-900051.01
)
GILLILAND BRITTANY MICHELLE, )
Defendant. )
ORDER
It is well established law that both a parent and a child have a fundamental right
to free association, care, and control with each other, provided the parent is a fitparent,
and that right extends to reasonable rights of visitation for a non-custodial situation.
See, e.g., Watkins v. Lee, 227 So. 3d 84 (Ala. Civ. App. 2017); Ex parte E.R.G., 73 So. 3d 634
(Ala. 2011). If a parent has not been previously found to be unfit, "the law presumes
that it is in the best interest of a child to have complete and unrestricted association
with his or her parents." V.C. v. C.T., 976 So. 2d 465, 468 (Ala. Civ. App. 2007). A finding
of parental unfitness must be explicit and supported by clear and convincing evidence.
Of course, a simple determination of physical custody pursuant to a divorce does not
equate to a finding of parental unfitness.
In this case, there are significant questions over where fault, if any, lies for
various alleged non-conformity with the custodial order, as there are regarding therapy
issues. The prior orders in this case did not address holiday visitation and do not
appear to contemplate that this case would still be pending for a second holiday season.
Allegations of personality conflicts, or even arguments, between the Mother, Father,
and/or Child have not been proven to the point that they would effect the rights of
DOCUMENT 429
parenting, free association, or visitation, nor does the scant evidence provide a
sufficient basis to deprive either parent of visitation during one of the child's last 4-5
holidays as a minor, especially given the multiple continuances filed in this case.
Accordingly, MOTION TO SET ASIDE ORDER GRANTING COURT-ORDERED
HOLIDAY VISITATION filed by MCGREGOR CHRISTOPHER BLAINE is hereby
DENIED.
DONE this 12thday of November, 2025.
/s/ KEVIN HALL
CIRCUIT JUDGE
